applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several key reasons: 1) The document is a pension scheme rules document, not an advertisement. It is a legal/contractual document that outlines the rules, definitions, and operations of a pension life cover scheme. 2) The regulation specifically pertains to warning statements in advertisements for financial services, while this document serves as the foundational rules document for scheme trustees and members. 3) While the document does contain some informational sections and contact details, it is not promotional or advertising material that would fall under the scope of Regulation 82's requirements for warning statements in advertisements. 4) The document's purpose is to establish and govern the operation of a pension scheme, not to promote or advertise financial services to consumers. The content is purely instructional and regulatory in nature.
regulation_text: 82. (1) A regulated entity shall ensure that warning statements required by these Regulations to be included in advertisements - (a) are reviewed to ensure that they meet the criteria specified in Regulation 45, and (b) subject to paragraph (2), appear simultaneously in the advertisement with any reference to the benefits of the advertised financial service. (2) Where an advertisement is an audio advertisement, warning statements required by these Regulations to be included in advertisements may be provided at the end of the audio advertisement concerned.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
